Makefile of AMATEUR

All compilation options are covered in the Makefile.

  • all (or none) - compiles all different parts
  • part.o - compiles the corresponding part
  • run{xaomszht} - compiles amateur and runs it for a small snapshot
  • batch - compiles amateur and runs through all high-resolution snapshots
  • doc - generates the documentation
  • tags - generates tags for use in Emacs
  • clean - removes all *.o in preparation for a future distribution
  • tidy - remove all except sourcecode

Modifications

Whenever the Makefile is modified, all source code files are recompiled the next time make is invoked.

Documentation

The documentation for AMATEUR can be (re)generated by issuing

make doc

doxygen output is then available in ./doc.
